title: Point Reyes National Seashore: Wildflowers
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Plants     Wildflowers                Wildflowers         California poppies, a tidy-tips, and a checker-bloom.   For wildflower enthusiasts, a trip to Point Reyes in the spring and summer is a must. Wildflowers bloom at the Seashore from February through August, depending on many factors including the amount and frequency of rains. Colors range throughout the spectrum and across many sizes. They can be viewed in many habitats including woodlands, scrublands, grasslands, coastal bluffs, beach, dunes, disturbed areas, and salt marsh edges. Abbotts Lagoon, Chimney Rock, and Tomales Point are just a few of the locations where the flowers bloom early in the season. Remember that wildflowers are protected by law in national parks. Please don't pick the wildflowers or crush them by straying off the trails.  Point Reyes National Seashore Wildflower Species List (341 KB PDF) Poster: Splashes of Color on the Landscape (4,079 KB PDF) The Marin Chapter California Native Plants Society has also compiled Comprehensive Plant Lists for various Marin County locations, including Abbotts Lagoon and Chimney Rock.
